headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Dives, Cybersecurity Plays Hit As Software Sinks; Gold Stocks Shine (Live Coverage)
summary: Indexes, including the Dow Jones industrials, dived on the stock market today. The EU made a Trump tariff move. Novo stock slid but gold plays shined.

headline: Software Stocks Are Having Another Ugly Day
summary: The weeks-long selloff in software stocks deepened Monday amid general unease about the threat posed by AI. Software-makers AppLovin, CrowdStrike, Datadog, Workday, Expedia and Intuit were all among the S&P 500's worst 10 performers around midday, dropping at least 7%.

headline: Dystopian AI report sinks DoorDash, software stocks
summary: Investing.com -- DoorDash shares fell 7% on Monday, while Uber dropped 3%, Salesforce declined 4%, MongoDB slid 6%, and ServiceNow lost 4%, following publication of a dystopian scenario analysis from Citirini Research examining potential risks from rapid AI advancement. Visa and Mastercard also declined, falling over 2%.

headline: AppLovin Surges 11% While Tempus AI and Micron Also Outpace Most AI Stocks
summary: AI stocks generally rose last week as the VanEck Semiconductor ETF rose 1.8%. The sector continues to have a broad divergence as software stocks struggle in 2026 and certain segments of semiconductors like memory and networking see strong gains. Let’s dive into some of the biggest news across the past week with some notable winners ... AppLovin Surges 11% While Tempus AI and Micron Also Outpace Most AI Stocks

headline: Apple, Microsoft, AppLovin And An Energy Stock: CNBC's 'Final Trades'
